column2: indútus est Dòminus fortitúdinem, et praĕcínxit se. Ètenim firmávit orbem terraĕ qŭi non commovébitur. ^ The Lord hath reigned, he is clothed with beauty
column3: the Lord is clothed with strength, and hath girded himself. For he hath established the world which shall not be moved.

column2: a sáĕculo tu es. ^ Thy throne is prepared from of old

column1: 3 ^ Elevavérunt flúmina, Dòmine, elevavérunt flúmina vocem suam~
column2: elevavérunt flúmina fluctûs suos, ^ The floods have lifted up, O Lord, the floods have lifted up their voice
column3: the floods have lifted up their waves,

column1: 4 ^ a vócibus aqŭárum multárum. Mirábiles elațiónes maris~
column2: mirábilis in altîs Dòminus. ^ with the noise of many waters. Wonderful are the exaltations of the sea
column3: wonderful is the Lord on high.

column1: 5 ^ Testimónia tua credibìlia facta sunt nìmis~
column2: domum tuam dècet sanctitúdo, Dòmine, in longitúdinem diérum. ^ Thy testimonies are become exceedingly credible
column3: holiness becometh thy house, O Lord, unto length of days.
